item.title: Quantum Search Algorithm
item.description: By examining this operator in the instance of $|\Psi\rangle = \frac{1}{2} \left(|00\rangle +|01\rangle+|10\rangle+|11\rangle \right)$, i.e. the equal superposition of two qubits, and a post-phase-flip state $|k\rangle_2 = \left(a_{00}|00\rangle +a_{01}|01\rangle+a_{10}|10\rangle+a_{11}|11\rangle \right)$, we expect to preview the behavior of this so called phase-shift operator. The general form of this transformation is $\displaystyle{(2 |\Psi\rangle \langle\Psi| - I) |k\rangle_n = 2 |\Psi\rangle \langle\Psi||k\rangle_n - |k\rangle_n}$. For a clear writing, the part before the minus sign will be evaluated first.
